name: C. Matching Numbers
statement:
You are given an integer n. Pair the integers 1 to 2n (i.e. each integer
should be in exactly one pair) so that each sum of matched pairs is
consecutive and distinct. Formally, let (a_i, b_i) be the pairs that you
matched.
{a_1, b_1, a_2, b_2,
ldots, a_n, b_n
} should be a permutation of
{1, 2,
ldots, 2n
}. Let the sorted list of
{a_1+b_1, a_2+b_2,
ldots, a_n+b_n
} be s_1 < s_2 <
ldots < s_n. We must have s_{i+1}-s_i = 1 for 1
le i
le n - 1.
